page.title: 05Weir's of Cathcart
page.content: Weirs was founded in 1886 by James and George Weir. At that time it was only a small machine shop but through the years it has grown larger and larger and now there are two thousand people working in the Cathcart Plant alone. Altogether Weirs employs about ten thousand people. Weirs has factories scattered all over the world, the largest factory being in Cathcart. Pumps are manufactured for ships, submarines and the oil industry, and even pumps that flush the toilet. It takes from two weeks to two and a half years to build a pump. There are thirty five cleaners in the Cathcart factory. Weirs have associates in Spain, France, Nottingham, India and two in Saudi Arabia as well as one in Canada. Pumps are not mass produced as each order is manufactured separately.
